Reviews.Title: “Mokara Spa”
Reviews.Author: BT2010
Reviews.Content: Bought a Travelzoo certificate on 4/18 for a massage and mani/pedi. Booked 3 rooms at The Omni for 5/26 and then began the nightmarish ordeal of attempting to book our spa treatments. Called and had to leave a message on Thursday, called promptly at 10:00am on Friday and had to leave another message. Tried calling throughout the day Friday and Saturday. Finally reached someone on Sunday and was told all weekends were fully booked thru June10th. Found that to be a bit over the top, that a pa would be fully booked every weekend for the next 60 days! After rearranging our plans I called back on Monday morning and was told all weekends were fuly booked through October. Which is the date of the expiration of our Travelzoo certificate. I then called the hotel and Left a message with the director of rooms as no one else in management could be reached or wouldn't take my call. At this point I plan to cancel my 4 Travelzoo certificates, cancel our 3 hotel rooms, file a complaint with Travelzoo and with the Omni Corporate office. I have never had his issue with The Cresent or The W hotels and spas. I feel that the Mokara Spa is trying to scam he Travelzoo Certficate and forces holders to only use their certificate during the weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: cmnix
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved our stay at the Omni Dallas Hotel. Visiting Dallas for a mini-vacation to celebrate a birthday. The staff had everything right from the time we walked in the hotel. Check in was the fastest i had ever seen. In our room was birthday cake, a card signed by the staff and personalized greeting on our television. The room has super nice with a view of downtown Dallas. During our stay we visited the spa, EXCELLENT!. We had drinks in the bar and watched the basketball games. Later in our stay we ate breakfast and lunch at Texas Spice. The buffets for both were delicious. Overall, the stay was perfect...so happy this is where we picked for our excursion to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Over charged”
Reviews.Author: Karla H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night and they charged us for 2 nights now we have overdraft fees everywhere.We called they didn't care about putting us out down right rude. They told us it could take up to 10 days to get a refund. Don't let there smiling faces fool you it's all about the money.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable HUGE hotel”
Reviews.Author: dantex
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas and needed a downtown hotel at the last minute. I called the 800# from my car and inquired about rooms. The young man I talked to sounded a little confused about which hotel I wanted. I told him the Dallas Omni, the new one at the convention center downtown. He found it and said the rate was $99. I was surprised and asked if that was the hotel on Lamar, donwntown at the convention center. He said yes. So I headed downtown to claim my room. The hotel driveway was really crowded and kind of chaotic with people directing traffic and confusing traffic barriers. I left my car with the valet ($25) and went to checkin. The nice young lady behind the desk couldn't find my reservation so I showed her the confimation # that had just arrived on my phone. She said that there was a mistake and I was booked at the Omni in Richardson...grrr. I told her that I needed to stay downtown. She said they had rooms for $169. I asked if she could match the price I was quoted, she said no and apologized. I was running late for an evening appointment so I took it. The lobby is huge and impressive and was full of youngsters attending the weekend volleyball event at the adjacent convention center. My room was on the 7th floor. When entering the room there is a key port that contols the electricity inside the room( like most other countries) The room was average size and very stylish. It had several modern amenties like a motion sensored footlight that lights the floor for a night time trip to the bathroom, an in-mirror bathroom tv, floor to ceiling windows, a nice desk with two chairs, coffe maker and refrigerator but no mini bar, safe and robes. The bed was very comfortable and the entire room was cozy and had nice decor and accents. It was also really quiet, even with the young volleyball crowd crawling the halls. Overall it's a really nice hotel but it's huge and built for conventions. Other than the convention center there is very little around it that is appealing but if you need to be on the southwest side of downtown, at the convention center or Belo this is a much better choice than the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErnFinch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far one of the most impressive places I have had the pleasure staying at on my business trips to Dallas. I usually stay at the Hilton Anatole and love that hotel as well, however I decided to give the Omni a try and I was thoroughly impressed. The staff was beyond helpful and very friendly. The restaurants and fitness center were great as well. The jewel of the hotel was by far the roof-top pool and bar area. I had the luxury of spending one of my days at the pool and had to remind myself that I was in Dallas TX and not at a beach resort. Music, infinity pool, hot tub, fire pits, private cabanas, fully stocked bar... A++++ Give this place a try.Â

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Easily Acsessible!”
Reviews.Author: khacy19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel for business and found it to be a lovely, clean property! The parking was very pricey -$18 a day. It was within walking distance to historic downtown area. We enjoyed dinner one night at Gator's; we walked. The rooms were artfully decorated/modern! I loved that they were eco-concious and did not replace towels only if they were on the floor. Your room key must stay in the clot by th light switch for the ligts to stay on. Again, an eco-friendly measure which allows for the lights to stay on while you are in the room. For a hotel that is so beautiful and big, I found it easy to get around withour getting lost. The staff was helpful and courteous, too.

Reviews.Title: “A few glitches, but overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: pat1030
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Clean room, very modern. Large shower, TV in the mirror. Cons: 1. Almost as soon as we checked in and laid down to rest, someone knocks on the door and when we donâ€™t jump up immediately, tries to come in. Fortunately, we had locked it. They were there to â€œchange the AC filterâ€�. Really? When a guest is relaxing? There is no list for the maintenance man to tell him which rooms are occupied? 2. Half hour later â€“ room service! Only problem? We hadnâ€™t ordered room service; they had the wrong room number. 3. $18 a day to park, even when youâ€™re a guest, but maybe thatâ€™s normal for downtown. 4. Shower water presser was low and no way to change.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel, a work of art”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed there this Easter weekend. It is a brand new hotel in Dallas and lights up the skyline at night. The light show reveal as a work of art. When you pull up, you can either choose to valet park or self park. I think the valet uses the same garage. We chose to do the self park and walked into the lobby and were promptly greeted by very professional staff. The lobby is spacious and adjoining it, is the hotel lounge where there is a fire pit and comfy seating perfect for cocktails. The elevators are tucked inside a hallway and easy to miss. There are separate elevators to different sections of the hotels depending on the floors, reminiscent of vegas style hotels. Once we arrived on our floor, you will notice the breathtaking views of the city. Our room had a view of the WFAA tower (tv station) and the pool. (not that impressive). The good: Our room was very welcoming, very modernized. The television displays a welcome with your name and soft elevator music welcomes you into the room. There are two modern chairs and a nice decor welcomes you in. THe bathroom is spectacular with stand up shower large enough to fit 4. There is a electronic mirror with a television inside it! That was very nice as well, to be able to get ready and watch the news of the day. The Bad: The toilet was uncomfortable, I am not sure if these are ADA toilets, but seat height was very high, almost uncomfortable to sit for a 5'5" person. Also, the water pressure for the shower was soft as well, there was no way to turn up the pressure from the shower head. We found only one robe, so had to call for second robe, but this was brought up promptly. Also had to call about the "chiller", as I referred to it as a refrigerator and was educated that it is a chiller. Although, I didn't have time to call back and tell the front desk it wasn't chilling. Amenities: 1. The pool: Awesome view of the city, a must see! The chairs do fill quickly so you must go early to claim a good chair. The pool is heated and was quite comfortable. There is also a small jacuzzi but I didn't get to use it since there were already 5 people in it, hogging it for an hour. There is a bar there but when we went up at 11, we were told it was not open yet and we were turned away. The same happened to two other couples. I think they opened on that saturday around 1130. 2. Gym: The typical treadmills, elliptical and bikes with tvs on them. There are some weight machines and free weights. It was not crowded when I went and I enjoyed the privacy. Water and soft towels, headsets available. 3. Starbucks : inside the gift shop. Makes your usual lattes. 4. Gift shop: some cute items inside, from jewelry to candles, lotions, wine, and everyday travel items. and local texas items as well. 5. Restaurants: bob's steak house- a known Dallas steakhouse. Did not get to try but saw there was a huge (size of wall) screen, good for watching games! We enjoyed our stay, the service was wonderful, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: micalarae
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Omni last week, and I inadvertantly left my briefcase at the hotel. I called to see if anyone had turned it in, and Tommy with Loss Prevention took down my claim. He called me back that night to get additional information and then called me back later that night to inform me that the briefcase had been found. I went to pick it up the next morning, and the entire process was handled with professionalism and exceptional service. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Marc M
Reviews.Content: The most amazing hotel for the value in Dallas. The views were amazing. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I never saw anything out of place, dirty, or an employee that wasn't happy to see me. We stayed on the 18th floor, and couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay. The pool are was the best part. So tranquil and beautiful. We have stayed at the W in Dallas as well, and this beat it hands down. Everything about it was better, the service, view, pool, people staying there, employees, food. The W better watch out with this hotel competing for the same clientel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: neveragain52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great , good views every way you look ,great service,friendly people, the price of the room i think was reasonable, for what we where getting.only thing i was dissapointed with was, the fact that they charged you $18 a day for parking even though you are a guest at their hotel. Oh and the food at the restaurant is expensive,other than that it was great. (no shuttle either)

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, experience not so much”
Reviews.Author: russkwtx
Reviews.Content: This is a tough call because our experience was not 4 star, but the manager on duty (Ian) was so accommodating that the hotel deserves the benefit of doubt. The rooms are very nice, we really liked the modern amenities such as built in TV screen into the bathroom mirror, motion-detection lights near the bed, and a super-nice shower with excellent shower head. Each room also comes with free Wi-Fi. When we checked in, Ian gave us a free upgrade, no doubt because it was Easter weekend and the hotel was not busy at all. We went to our room on the 20th floor and someone had been smoking there even though the hotel is smoke-free. The room stunk. So we had to return to the front desk and get a different room. We were given a room on the 16th floor. So essentially we lost our upgrade because a self-centered person decided he wanted to smoke illegally in his room. Thanks for that. The room was fine. But, our reservation said we were supposed to get a top three floor room (there are 23 floors). Plus, the bed seemed to a queen even though our reservation said king. I asked and they said it was king, but if so, it is a king for midgets only. The person who had the room before us set the alarm clock to go off at 2:30am. Very funny. We were dead asleep and were suddenly awakened. The wife reaches over to turn off the alarm. We start to drift back to sleep. Wrong, she only hit the snooze button, so 15 minutes later I have to get up, turn on the light and turn off the alarm. Just hilarious. Now it is really hard to get back to sleep. I am drifting off about 45 minutes later when a drunk jerk starts yelling on the floor and slams her door. Again, thanks for that, and oh, are you aware that other people are on the floor and may actually be trying to sleep at 4am? So basically we lost our upgrade and had our night ruined by selfish, centered jerks. It's not the hotel's fault, but the experience was not a good one. We had a reservation for Texas Spice for breakfast, but we got up early and just went home. Ian was great and comped part of the cost of the room, and that is why I am giving the hotel 4 stars. By the way, self-parking is available for $18 per day, but it may be worthwhile parking across Lamar at public parking and walking across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: stainged04
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity and access to the convention center since we wanted to attend a show there during our stay in Dallas. We were very happy with our choice, and would gladly stay at the Omni again. The check in process was very quick, and had us on the way to our room without delay. The room was well appointed, modern, and spacious. The seating area arranged near the floor to ceiling windows was a very nice touch and made for a nice place to enjoy the view of the city. The bed was very comfy with plenty of pillows, and the room had everything else that might be expected in a luxury hotel (safe, iron, mini-fridge, coffee station, etc.). After we got settled in the room, we were able to explore the rest of the common areas in the hotel and found them all to be excellent. The fourth floor houses the pool, spa, and fitness center. The only improvement that we could have asked for is it would have been great if the pool bar was open in the evenings. This area seems like it would be the perfect place to hang out, but it closes early. We were also able to try two of the restaurants during our stay. We went to the breakfast buffet at Texas Spice. The atmosphere and service were just great. However, we felt like the food was average and the selection was below average. We had higher expectations for the price. Lunch was at the Owner's Box. Again, the service here was very good. The food and prices were average at best. Overall, the service at this hotel was consistently good. Every staff member that we encountered was friendly and helpful. The valet service was prompt, and returned the car without incident. We could not have asked for any better service. Book here with confidence. You will like it!

Reviews.Title: “A very lively hotel, great for”
Reviews.Author: Skyler W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and son in December 2011. The hotel was brand new at the time, and it looked great. The rooms and service were great like all other Omni hotels I have stayed at. The rooftop area is really nice and designed very well. Since this is a convention hotel there is a bunch of movement and people and events going on during the day. Overall it was very enjoyable, the rooms have really cool art and nice furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: czewk
Reviews.Content: Stunning! Food is out of this world! The service is stellar...I love all the high end amenties that this hotel has to offer. I will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Hsm1959
Reviews.Content: I was my husband's plus one for a recent conference held at the hotel. From the first evening's welcome party on the 4th floor pool terrace (gorgeous) to the final meal in Texas Spice (right off the lobby), it was a delightful stay. The staff was beyond courteous, especially the ladies and gentlemen of their Loss Prevention Services. I managed to leave two garment bags of clothing hanging in the closet when we left on Sunday, and received both via FedEx by Tuesday morning. I only needed to make a quick phone call to set everything in motion. The room was wonderfully comfortable, spotless, beautifully decorated, and the TV screen in the bathroom mirror was quite the surprise! I understand the other two restaurants are also excellent, but Texas Spice, with its quiet oasis of calming decor and great organic food, was our choice for two meals. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal! Futuristic!”
Reviews.Author: blissfulmtgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for almost a week and was incredibly impressed. The service was invisible, but complete. The hotel is green and makes it look easy. The farm to table restaurant in the lobby was delicious. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the bed are like sleeping on a cloud. I hated to leave. It was such a carefree stay. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Hotel is a gem! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a business conference and went in a day early. The hotel was beautiful and brand new, just opened in November 2011. We spent our first afternoon at the glorious infinity pool and hot tub with lots of fun people watching and great views from the 3rd floor vista. We had planned to spend our second morning there before our meetings began and were disappointed to have a letter under the door the next morning telling us the pool would be closed the entire week for some maintenance. The hotel did arrange for us to visit another hotel (Aloft) just down the street, and even though it was nice and front desk very helpful on our visit, the pool did not compare to the Omni! Loved the rooms, very nicely appointed, the only challenge was with the Hotel being a green hotel the lighting was not very good. Add to this that the windows were being cleaned and we were asked to keep our blinds closed while in the room, and the room was VERY dark. A fun part of these rooms was when you get out of bed in the middle of the night and your feet hit the ground, a light comes on under the nightstand to show the way! If you are not an Omni Preferred guest, just go to their website and register (for free); this will give you FREE internet for your devices and delivery of a morning beverage for FREE too! There are coffee makers in the room if you prefer and bathrooms are luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but has issues”
Reviews.Author: catie3
Reviews.Content: As the title implies, this really is a nice property. Beautiful airy reception area. Nice room. We had a suite right where the building bends, and they did a good job making a kind of awkward space into a very comfortable suite. I will also mention now that they have a really, really nice gym. Other than those positives, though, it wasn't a perfect stay. We happened to arrive the afternoon before a marathon, so there were huge lines to check in, and our room wasn't ready for an hour. Not their fault that it happened to a be a high volume day, but not the best start to the stay. There was no "privacy" sign, so we had to make one of our own. I called for an extra comforter and got a light weight blanket that was questionably clean - not visibly dirty, but wrinkled and didn't smell freshly laundered. On our first whole day, the room wasn't made up until we called to request it at 6pm. At that point, I asked housekeeping for an extra comforter, and they brought one, so that was one problem solved. Also, the housekeeping staff were extremely friendly, which was definitely nice. Unfortunately, when we had arrived the day before, there was exactly one tissue in the tissue box. Both of us suffering from seasonal allergies, tissues were a must, and although we asked the friendly housekeeping staff for tissues two days in a row, we never got more than that one sad tissue. On our last full day, I turned on the shower and nothing happened. I waited and eventually a trickle came out. Eventually that trickle turned into a cold, low pressure stream - enough for me to take a cold shower. I was just able to rinse off when it stopped completely again. I would have called maintenance but I was in a hurry. By the time I got back, the shower was fully functional again. All together, not the best stay.

Reviews.Title: “Coulda been 5 stars except for...”
Reviews.Author: IndyIronman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the evening of 3/24/2012 at the Omni in Dallas as part of the Rock n Roll Half Marathon weekend. With the exception of one particular screw up (which was eventually made right), we were very pleased with the Omni. We stayed in room 1320 which has a view of that lighted ball thingy that's a Dallas landmark. Here's what kept this review from being 5 stars: When we checked in, we specifically asked the young man at the desk (we don't remember his name) about getting a refridgerator brought to our room. He said that every room had one but that it wouldn't freeze anything. Since we didn't need anything frozen, we were fine with that. So we get to our room and get everything unpacked, including a few bottles of water in the "fridge." It turns out the "fridge" is actually a wine cooler. But by the time we discovered it and called the front desk (about 9:30 at night), we were told there were no mini fridges available. The Omni sent someone from Engineering to be sure the wine cooler was on its coldest setting. Here's the good part...The engineering guy (we don't remember his name, either. He was a tall african american guy and very helpful) asked if we wanted a mini fridge. We told him that the front desk told us there weren't any left. He just asked again if we wanted one. When we said "yes," he said he'd be back in about 5 minutes. Sure enough, he came back with a mini fridge. It turns out the guy that probably gets paid the least was the most valuable person to us right then and there. Well done, Engineering dude, well done! The next morning, I asked the concierge (I think his name was Jeff) to help me with our flight check in. He had us checked in and our boarding passes printed in no time. Nice! The room was very nice. The little floor light that automatically comes on when your feet hit the floor is a great idea. No more stubbing your toes or fumbling for your slippers if you need to get up in the middle of the night. Speaking of lights...you have to keep your room card in a card reader to activate your room lights. I suppose this is an energy conservation thing. Again, if they hadn't messed up the mini fridge thing, this would have been 5 stars. But had the engineering dude not been so helpful, it would have been 3 stars. Would we recommend this to friends? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: marcie5785
Reviews.Content: This is a great place! Clean, friendly, great restaurants! Love the decorations and the TV in the bathroom mirror doesn't hurt! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristi H
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a conference in Dallas. Loved this hotel! The decor in the common areas and in the rooms was beautiful. Very chic and sophisticated, but also cozy and comfortable. Took full advantage of the chair and ottoman in the room. Beautiful Dallas themed artwork. Several very thoughtful touches such as an automatic floor light that comes on if you need to get up during the night. Also, loved that the shower faucet is on the opposite end of the shower than the nozzle-you don't get wet while starting your shower! Also thought all the seating in every nook and cranny in the lobby and other common areas was great. A wonderful stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Bud56
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Very friendly staff from the front desk to the restaurant staffs. I had to ship something on Sunday. The front desk took the box and everything was done for me, they even taped it up for us. The room was great with great views of the city. It is within walking distance of restaurants and downtown. It was nice to be connected to the convention center. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: MJIYN2010
Reviews.Content: Very friendly accommodating staff. Met all of our requests and then some. We need a late check out and the hotel was happy to do it for us. Plus, we had a great view!

Reviews.Title: “For a hotel of this caliber, is it too much to ask for a timely check-in?”
Reviews.Author: Lsntx
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for the Dallas Rick N Roll marathon weeks ago. Came to check in at 5:30 pm (normal check in time is 3 pm) and were told our room wasn't ready & that they would call us- what?!?! An hour later, still waiting. Seriously, I've had much better service at lesser chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: bikinibottomdweller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during spring break. Got room 2353, which was on the top floor with a great view of the Dallas skyline on Main Street (see the accompanying pictures). Make sure you join the Omni select program to get free wi-fi, morning juices and newspaper. Also do the online check in and your room keys will be ready to pick up and go. The room was spacious and quiet, beds were comfy and true queen size as described. We all slept well and made for a relaxing trip. Weather was cold and rainy the first night, so we were going to rent an in room movie. But they only have some Starz movie network rental deal and the selection was very limited. I think there was 4 or 5 family movies, and some of those movies we never even heard of. No new/recent movies like we're used to seeing at other hotels. Used the pool with the kids twice. The first time, it was early evening before sunset and there was a staff at the pool to pass out towels. Second time was after dinner, there was no staff at the pool and we didn't know where to get towels. Checked the gym, no pool towels. Had to go back down to the lobby to request towels. Pool area was nice with more great views of downtown. Water was heated warm enough to enjoy even on a cold windy day. Ate at onsite Texas Spice restaurant twice for breakfast and twice for dinner. Breakfast buffet was good but didn't have pancakes. Our waiter had some pancakes made for us and they were delicious. Dinner was ok, I would say it was just average. The flat bread pizza under appetizer was good. The main courses were ok ... nothing to write home about. We did not like the Texas molasses tart but did order the chocolate chip cookies and milk twice. We wanted to try Bob's Chophouse, another onsite restaurant, but they didn't have a kids menu. Service overall was very good and friendly. People make an effort to smile and greet you. Parking was $18 for self parking, just remember to keep one room key so you can exit the garage when you check out. We had a good time in Dallas and at this hotel. I recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: backpackluxury
Reviews.Content: Boy, you don't get many of these from me! But this hotel stands out in every way. I don't know when I last stayed in an Omni but I'll be checking out a few more in the future based on this. Where to start? Well, I was at an event at the convention center so the location was perfect -but being right downtown it's covenient to the West End for all the restaurants within just a few blocks walking. Ditto JFK sites. The design and functionality of the rooms is amazingly well thought out with surprising and pleasant little touches. The service is spot on. Join their hotel club and get free Internet, discounted parking and morning beverage to your room immediately. I left a shirt in a drawer and they called me the next day and it's on the way. I loved the casual lounge with large chairs and nooks for a drink and relaxation. I could go on but in a nutshell if it is even a consideration to stay here don't consider it... Just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxat63
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that you just cant go wrong with. The rooms and views are wonderful. Staff is great

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Airmann
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with spouse, family, or business travel. Concierge was very helpful. Stayed during St. Patrick's Day and was loud that night, but staff was friendly and quick to direct attention to ensure all guests had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for your Dallas stay”
Reviews.Author: Tarnold8200
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, and I love the fact that each one is made distinct by the addition of local art. They are quite spacious and full of high tech touches, like the TV in the bathroom mirror and motion sensor lights. The restaurants were excellent. The three meal a day restaurant is called Texas Spice, and is committed to sourcing all products within 200 miles of the hotel. The black pepper buttermilk biscuits are most excellent, as were the Dublin Dr. Pepper ribs and the sweet chili brisket. The beet carpaccio with goat cheese and quail eggs on top was also a very nice treat. The service was attentive throughout the hotel, I would never have guessed it was opening day if I did not already know. They have a great sports bar called the Owners Box. I can see myself there many times in the future watching the full slate of NFL games. They also have a high end steakhouse, which is legendary in Dallas, called Bobâ€™s Steak and Chop House. I did not eat there, but if it is anything like the other Bobâ€™s in Dallas, it will be amazing. On the fourth floor, they have an outdoor terrace and infinity pool, all with exceptional views of Dallas. Mokara Spa is also on this floor, and the treatments there were some of best I have experienced in that past few years. Product wise, this is the best in the state right now. On the service side, they tower over notorious offenders like the Anatole, and actually treat people well. The dÃ©cor of the hotel makes it obvious that you are in Dallas, without beating you over the head with that fact. Like most Omniâ€™s this hotel makes you feel welcome and at home, but is upscale and very luxurious with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: ez369
Reviews.Content: My reviews won't be much different than others have posted about the Omni as of lately, but this may reinforce your decision to reserve here if you're looking for reviews in order to book. The one thing that stands out the most for me about the property is the excellent service I received. All of the staff that I interacted with were both very professional and cordial, giving me a feeling of them "going out of their way to please" type of service. The hotel while a larger convention type hotel, had service as personable as a boutique hotel during my stay. The bellhop followed me with the luggage from car to check in to the room, so I didn't need to call down to have it brought up. Different valet attendants remembered me and my name throughout the course of my stay during the weekend. I was very impressed with them immediately remembering my name and not even having to look at the tags attached to the key. Before deciding on this property, I contemplated several other properties, most notably smaller boutique properties in the downtown and uptown area, and nearby Marriott properties since I have status there. In the end, I chose the Omni just because I wanted to stay at the newest hotel in town and because I've been very happy staying at other Omni properties in Texas. My reservation was made through their website and a day before check in, I was offered an excellent deal to confirm an upgrade to an executive suite, but declined since I was not going to be in the room much. I reserved a double queen bed and got just that. I wanted the double queen instead of the king so I would have the bathtub/shower combo instead of just a walk-in shower. Had a view facing the downtown skyline but didn't look out too much. There were a lot of pillows on the beds, and they were very comfortable, both really soft and supportive at the same time. HDTV had enough channels to keep me entertained. The clock radio was an IHome one, so it had the iphone/ipod dock which was great! The nightstand between the two beds has an infrared sensor with an LED light, so that when it's dark and you hop off the bed, the LED light shines a beam on the carpet so you can kinda see where you are going. The wi-fi in the room worked seamless. The bathroom was decent sized, a little larger would have been nicer! Tub had a curved shower rod and there was quite a bit of space when taking the shower since the bathtub had a ledge with almost a foot of room between the tub and the bathroom wall. The lighting in the bathroom was fine, and everyone has already commented about the built in tv in the mirror. I didn't order room service so I won't be able to comment on that. I didn't dine on property, except for having a few drinks at The Owners Box. When I went in, it was busy, with hardly a seat at the bar. Perfect place to watch a sports game, as there were tv's and HD projections galore. Pricing was typical for a hotel bar, but it didn't feel like the typical boring hotel bar. Each time I called down to have the car brought around, the time estimate was spot on, with it usually being about 10 minutes. If I'm in the Dallas area again and need to book something downtown, I wouldn't hesitate at all to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Theodora8
Reviews.Content: I wish I could recommend this hotel but I just can't. If you plan on sleeping at all, this is not the hotel you want. I actually live in downtown Dallas so if you're visiting this might help you decide. Occasionally I will spontaneously check into a nearby hotel, turn off all communication devices and get away from a stressful week. I normally do this a few times a year so I've stayed at many hotels. For me, I prefer the Hotel Palomar but wanted to try this one out because it's new. I was warned by a friend about the amount of people that go through there but I've stayed at larger hotels in Vegas with no issues. My room for two nights was a superior on a high floor facing downtown Dallas. The room was very cool with a tv in the mirror, lots of modern electronics, and a large shower. I don't ever use the glassware in hotel rooms but I still look at them (they were dirty on the inside). The service was excellent with every person I talked to. Room service was fast and friendly even if the food was not very good. The spa there is one of the best I've been to anywhere. My problem with the hotel, though, overshadowed all of that. The windows and walls are extremely thin. Even from a high floor I had trouble sleeping from the people in front of the hotel and the hotel is situated away from all the nightlife. I knew the majority of the names of the people in the next room because of the thin walls and I could clearly hear entire conversations from anyone in the hallway and peple were always in the hallway. I'm a very heavy sleeper who has even slept soundly on second floors facing entrances to nightclubs in Madrid and Barcelona. I've slept soundly facing busy streets in Paris and the ground floor next to a hostel in Istanbul. I've slept through an earthquake. I probably got about six hours total while at the Omni. The only other problem I had was both times I went to the gym. The first night, the door was strangely wide open and while I worked out a maintenance man was giving tours of the facility (this was at 11 pm). I would be in the middle of a set and random men in the group would come within inches of me and just stare into my face! Other people with backpacks would walk through to go to the pool door, realize a room key was needed and then walk out. I don't think any if these people were staying there. Some even got on the machines in their jeans and wearing their bags. The second night the door was closed so you had to use your room key. Both nights the maintenance guys would wander by and stop to work out! With their full trash bags next to them! It was just really strange and uncomfortable. Overall, as great as the service was and how cool the rooms were, they can't fix thin walls and windows. Only go here if you want to be close to Dealey Plaza and have really good ear plugs. To relax: Hotel Palomar Nightlife: Joule or Zaza A great view of downtown: The W I've been to all of the above so I'm confident about those choices. Also,

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For National Sales Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Rita W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my national sales meeting which lasted a week. I was very impressed with the appearance of the hotel. It was very modern and upscale. The hotel workers were very helpful and friendly. The security was outstanding. The main thing I wasn't satisfied with was house keeping. I found a couple of things on the floor when I first checked in that let me know the room wasn't vacuumed thoroughly. Another minor problem was coming in after dinner and my room key didn't work. I called from my co-workers room and Security brought another key upstairs to me. I found out later that a few of my co-workers had the same problem. These things weren't deal breakers and doesn't stop me from rating them a four. The facility was beautiful, and the staff had a great attitude even when you complained. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Convention Surprise”
Reviews.Author: SeanKStewart
Reviews.Content: Had two conventions back to back and spent 7 nights at the Omni Dallas Hotel. Hotel is new, opened in November 2011. Property is well done with direct connection to the convention center. The room is very nice and features nice amenities for working or pleasure, only hiccups are inconsistent daily room cleaning. Texas Spice restaurant is a wonderful foodie spot and bar, make sure you have Nick at the bar make you one of his signature drinks. Awesome breakfast buffet with farm to table approach and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Conference attendee stay, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: tripcasey
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels and conferences due to my job. I think this being a brand new facility, they need to work out a few kinks, that being said.. we had a tremendous time, it was wonderful. Rooms: We had a beautiful room with a view of IH35. The bathrooms were very clean, and nice sized. My husband and I did not sleep well at all. It was the first time to be away from our kids in awhile and we were hoping to get some much needed rest by sleeping in, but the room would not cool down to a comfortable temperature. The bed was really uncomfortable and had really hot covers. Finally on the 3rd night, we stripped off all the blankets to try to at least be comfortable but we still did not sleep very good. It was just too hot and the beds too uncomfortable. Bathrooms have great toiletries - fyi you won't need to bring your own. Plenty of hangers in the closet I am usually cold natured and freezing everywhere I go. I'm the type of person that has the heated seat on in the car even in the summer if my husband has the AC down cold. So, I was really surprised, that I was hot the entire time I was there. (I did not leave the hotel for 4 days). The conference rooms, restaurants, etc were too hot. Granted, we had a huge amount of people there for our conference, that could have had something to do with it. Pool / Fitness I am training for a triathlon right now, so it was important to me to have a pool and decent fitness center. It was very nice, the pool large enough to do laps in (although its not square), it was adequate and beautiful. The fitness center is really nice and stocked with plenty of equipment. I thought it was a nice touch that they had these pretty water features, bar and fire pits right around the pool, so my husband could hang out and relax while I was swimming. We also headed up to the hot tub late at night, and had a great time, can't say enough good things about the pool area. I wish the bar had been open later. There are two restaurants and a coffee/snack bar. You can expect hotel prices there. I didn't think any of them were very good. I'll review Owner's Box and Texas Spice separately. Conference facilities: Rooms were hot, everything else was first class. The food was great, the service was excellent. We had a couple of big parties in addition to conference rooms, had a great time. I don't know if the hotel did our production (lights, audio/video, chairs, etc), but it was also first class. Check in / Check out: We had some problems with our bill. They had charged us for the valet, when we self-parked. They charged us for Internet when we were Omni Select guests. It was quickly taken care of, but you may want to double-check that everything is right. It ended up being over $100 in charges that got removed. Service: Very friendly and helpful staff, what you would expect in Texas :) We are Omni select guests, and they will give you two complimentary drinks each day. It was very nice, since they are normally $3 in the gift shop, a nice value-add. We forgot to hang the order on our door one night, so my husband called down that morning and they sent them up a few minutes later. That was really over and beyond - I was delighted. Overall, I would say aside from my complaints, it is a very nice, beautiful hotel. You should see it all lit up on the outside, I'll attach some pics. I would recommend it and will stay here again. I may bring a fan with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel with friendly staff and good facilities: highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Exmerlinboss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Although a large hotel it retained a sense of the personal thanks to its highly proficient and charming staff. I wish all hotels trained their people this well. The facilities were excellent, especially the gym and the outside pool, and the restaurants (and I tried all three) were good. Minor gripe was the wait to be seated at breakfast although there was an option to sit at a breakfast counter to get around this. And what a great location in the historic quarter. A bit pricey but excellent value. Highly recommended. Please note, the pin on the location is incorrect!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: travelingokgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible and so was everything about it. Room: Great decor, cleanest room ever, out of this world bathroom with television inside the mirror...seriously! Customer Service: The best I have ever received. I was pregnant and the operator (Brandy, I think) actually personally made me to peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and a glass of milk and hand delivered them to my room. She was incredible! Every time I called, they asked how I was and if I needed anything. Amenities: I ate at every restaurant and they were all great. The spa was excellent and all the employees were so nice. The gym was outstanding. The business center was fast, effiecient, and the gal working there was amazing. I cannot wait to go back to this hotel! It will be hard to top!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: DustinHecht
Reviews.Content: Clean. Nice rooms, tvs in mirrors HDTV aplus nice place too stay. Pool area was a little dirty but they came and cleaned it up while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “omni never fails”
Reviews.Author: msabas
Reviews.Content: First time in Dallas and I chose to stay at the Omni. I was not disappointed brand new hotel. Rooms are really nice with beautiful views of downtown. The kids always appreciate the kids backpack on arrival and the refreshments you get when your a omni select guest. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom had a tv in the mirror the kids enjoyed that. Staff was friendly and everyone who walked by always said hello. Concierge was great and the shuttle that takes you two miles around downtown was a great help too. The only thing that kind of confused me was that it being a brand new hotel there was no toilet seat covers in the bathroom downstairs:) Overall whenever I'm in Dallas I will definitely be back at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkhillis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here two nights in January when we attended a conference that was actually held at another Dallas hotel (that we did not want to stay at). We are Select Guest members and have always had excellent stays with Omni Mandalay, but we wanted to try the new Omni Dallas. We were not disappointed! Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised with an upgraded room--this type of excellent service, although never expected on our part, is always greatly appreciated and remembered! The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, as expected, and the service we received (every single person from valet and bell hop to check in/check out desk to gift shop personnel to wait staff and management at Texas Spice Restaurant to housekeeping) was above and beyond--exceptional service that I cannot say enough good things about!!! We did not catch everyone's names, but I would like to specifically mention David Santos (assistant manager at Texas Spice) and Jackie (Jacqueline) at the check in/check out desk as among some of the top people who really impressed us with friendly, caring attitudes and taking a personal interest in our stay and needs. Of course, none of this matters if the rooms are not clean and well maintained, and again we were not disappointed! Our room was immaculate and beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. We are excited to return to this hotel in just a couple of weeks for my husband's birthday celebration weekend. We are looking forward to the same exceptional experience as before and we are sure that we will not be disappointed. Thanks Omni Dallas for not only meeting, but truly exceeding our high expectations! We have become spoiled and pampered by our Omni experiences overall through the years and will not stay at another hotel chain (unless forced to because there happens not to be an Omni in the particular city to which we are travelling). Greatly looking forward to our next stay at Omni Dallas! Kelly & Lon Hillis

Reviews.Title: “The Big D”
Reviews.Author: atx_southside
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during the week in Feb 2012 to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. Everything about the trip was perfect and went smoothly. Pro: The hotel looks like it was just recently remodeled. Its got the trendy look of a W Hotel. Everything was very clean and very fancy. The location is right in the middle of Downtown where the Convention Center is. What I liked about it the most was the service. For example, they have a complementary car service we used it to go to the Mavericks game. There were two people serving us and they immediately called the drivers to estimate how soon they would arrive and kept us informed of their location. In addition, when I checked in I had just mentioned it was my girlfriend's birthday. About an hour later, a bottle of champagne, chocolates, wine glasses and a note was delivered to the door. I also had breakfast at Texas Spice. The food was top notch. Again the service was incredible with our OJ and water always being filled and new plates given to us. Con: The only con was the $18 self service parking. However, I believe that's normal for Downtown Dallas. Overall: I had a wonderful experience here and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marushka
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a beautiful, new hotel in the middle of downtown Dallas. The front desk and concierge were very efficient and helpful, but be careful when using their car valet service. On Saturday night they were very busy (no excuse) and were very slow (1/2 hour) in bringing our car around. Otherwise, everything was great, comfy lobby, super comfy beds and the TV in the bathroom mirror was very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Location is almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: JanieU
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been open a couple of months and it looks amazing. I was staying in Texas from uk on holiday and went to Dallas for one night to see the city. The Omni really looks the part and was great value. If you are in Dallas on a conference then this is perfect as it is right next to the conference centre. From this hotel you can walk to the JFK museum and see various other sites downtown. The only slight problem was that there were not many places to eat within short walking distance of the hotel but not many people walk in Texas....... We decided to eat in the hotel and went to the sports bar which was good fun but huge amounts of food. The room was beautiful and we had a great view from the twelfth floor. I'd read about the tv screen built into the bathroom mirror which worked a treat and meant that my husband could watch tv while shaving. There was a huge shower it it would have been good to have a bath as well so I could have appreciated the tv even more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! Our room was so stylish and luxurious that we did not want to leave. Friendly service and great restaurants on the premises. I highly recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mloois83
Reviews.Content: Good looking hotel but can't handle the size. Managers are weak. Should not have 2 and half hour wait for room service. Hate to see how it is when a convention is going on.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a brand new Vegas hotel minus the casino.”
Reviews.Author: 514VABeach
Reviews.Content: I never would have thought an Omni would earn five stars but this one does. The furnishings are beautiful, rooms are spacious and the staff made it clear that they love their job and their guests. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and the sports bar is one of the best I've seen with plenty of comfy seating for large groups. If you want a little outdoor space, ask for a room on the 5th floor with a small patio area. This will be my go to hotel in Dallas for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wsr0224
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, it is connected right to the convention center. Has a Starbucks right in the hotel as well. The sports bar has good food and beer prices weren't too bad. Hard to find a seat if you don't get there right after convention is over. They have outdoor seating and it's amazing to be able to sit outside and realx with friends after a long day. This hotel has awesome bathrooms, very up to tech standards. (has TV in bathroom mirrors) They offer free internet if you sign up on their website ahead of time as well as a free morning beverage delivered to your door. I can't wait to stay again! They do also offer a turn down service at night if that's something you are interested in!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay !”
Reviews.Author: LReinhardt
Reviews.Content: For a hotel open less than two months when a large crowd of Houston Cougars arrived (after 25,000 Rave folks hit Dallas 2-3 days before), new staff did a good job - nice room, great view, easy check in/check out/valet service (although some UH folks waited for hours to get rooms due to the Rave crowd checking out so late). Enjoyed luxurious bathrobes, comfy bed, plush linens, bathroom mirror TV (too much fun!), spacious bath tub/shower combo ! And their sports bar is over the top ! Blue Moon on draft! Plus outside fireside sitting is cozy too. Up on the roof pool/spa area is gorgeous ! Restaurants are within walking distance and easy to get to. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robungle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention. Rooms are very comfortable and we received wonderful service across the board. My only minor complaint is the lighting in the rooms - wished there were more lights when trying to get ready in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: seb02a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Dallas (downtown location) this past weekend for my sisterâ€™s bachelorette party. We had checked in online so as soon as we walked up to the check in desk, we were presented our room key and on our way. The entire valet and check in process literally took about 45 seconds, it was wonderful. When we arrived to our room, we had been given an odd room which meant that we had a GORGEOUS view of the buildings in downtown Dallas. The room still smells new and everything is so fresh and clean. I am one that refuses to take my shoes off in hotel rooms, but the plush rug in the bathroom was one of the most incredible things I have ever stepped on. Itâ€™s white so Iâ€™m almost certain they clean it in between each guest, but truly felt like you were walking on clouds. The beds were the perfect amount of softness and the pillows were just as wonderful. Oh my goodness, the lights! When you first enter the room, you have to put your room key in a little slot in order to turn the lights on. When you leave and take your key with you, the lights turn out automatically after 30 seconds, it was really neat and a great way for the hotel to conserve energy. Also, when you have to get up at night when it is dark, there is a motion censored light underneath the night stand in between the two beds. This was one of the coolest features Iâ€™ve seen as it was just enough light to help me find my way, but not too much to wake someone else up. It is a genius idea that I hope many other hotels begin to implement. The fitness room was state of the art and the roof top infinity pool was heated, which is very nice if you want to swim anywhere in Texas this time of year! The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel was the price of parking. Valet is $25 a night (pretty standard) but self parking is $18 a night. We had 4 vehicles that we had to park for the evening and parking turned out to be more than what we paid for the room. I should have called before we arrived and maybe we could have carpooled, but unfortunately found out to late. Lesson learned, but wanted to at least warn others of the high parking prices.

Reviews.Title: “ALA Midwinter Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MuncieMom
Reviews.Content: Attended the ALA Mid Winter conference with 1,000s in Dallas on Jan. 20-23. Was fortunate to get reservations with our group at the NEW (opened 11-11-11) Omni Dallas. Huge treat that Hotel is attached to the Convention Center downtown Dallas. Awesome perks and upgrades if you ask. We were treated to Larry and the Hotel town car to run a quick errand (must be in a 2 mile radius) but Larry went out of his way to make sure we found what we needed for the conference booth @ Radio Shack. Also, as a member of Omni's Preferred Guest (freq stayer) membership was spoiled by the Preferred Guest Juice/Coffee/Paper delivery (gratis) in the AM. Fluffy Robes, GREAT 10th floor view of downtown skyline, amazing artwork, decor and cool features like lights on the floor when you got out of bed all totaled for a hard to beat Hotel experience, Staff was friendly and location ideal for short cab rides to other areas of town, e.g. Deep Ellum for nightlife and entertainment. Dinning choices abound at the hotel and tried 2 of 3 restaurants for every pocketbook and choice of beverage. Nothing like a Shiner Bock in warm evening temps outside by the fire-pit @ the awesome sports bar lounge. ALA was the largest crowd the Omni has seen since its opening. According to the local Dallas news over 10,000 attendees coming and going from the convention. I would recommend this hotel -and hope to return soon back to Dallas for fun (no work). ***** in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dot11do
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my niece's Cheer competition and I have to say the rooms are beautiful and some of the nicest we have stayed in in a while. The service is excellent until something goes wrong and then everyone is polite but you get nothing accomplished. Our room door was not latching it would click as if it closed but would not close....since we did not double check the lock it seems we left our door ajar. While we were at the convention an Ipad 2 was stolen out of our room. The security staff ( Loss prevention) very nice until you finally get to a supervisor and I hope no one EVER has to deal with a man named Sergio Bertrand he was polite as he made me feel like a liar and a cock roach. I had given them 2 days business to come up with a resolution and he told me they needed a week to check the door....The short of it is the rooms manager was a nice person and has an idea of customer service....they did not pay for the ipad in full but did pay for half. I wasted and entire Sunday trying to make a police report and plenty more time on the phone trying o resolve this issue....The fact that two women and two children slept with the hotel room ajar should have made them want to do a little more I would think, maybe comp my sister her room or offer us another chance at better expeirence. We spent with valet and room service well over $400 for a one night stay I just think they should have offered a little more....I would never ask it should have been offered. So in short the facility is amazing and MOST of the people exceptional but please if you stay there MAKE SURE YOUR DOOR CLOSES......You will have to dance through circles to get it made right but in short I believe they will make it right.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: NWABeachFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late December with my family. The hotel is brand new and some of the rooms haven't even been used yet. I can't say enough things about it. It is an eco-friendly hotel -- you insert your room key in a slot as you enter which activates the lights, tv, etc. Helps conserve energy in the room. Flat screen LED TV's in the room and a flat panel TV built into the mirror in the restroom. Very nice feature. The view of the downtown area from the top level floors are great. Service was spectacular from everyone in the hotel - everyone made you feel like you were welcome. Used the pre check-in online so everything was waiting at the front desk -- no paperwork to fill out, just pick up your keys and go. The sports bar was extremely nice -- seemed like hundreds of TV's around the bar showing every type of game on that day. Massive sized projection TV at the end of the room for whatever big game is showing. Service at the bar was a little poor. My wife and I sat there for over 15 minutes before one of the 6 bartenders took our order. Other than that, it was great. This is now my hotel of choice when staying in Dallas. If you have any business in the downtown area, you are very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Upscale Dallas-Themed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and shiny, clean and comfortable. We ended up here during the holidays on a Hotwire, but from now on, this will be the only place I will stay! The room was slick and modern, with a fabulous view of the Dallas skyline, and the entire hotel was Dallas-themed, which Texans will dig and non-Texans will hopefully appreciate (being that they are in Dallas and all)... We had Christmas brunch at the Texas Spice restaurant, which offers mostly local ingredients with a farm-to-market concept, and it was really really good. It was a buffet and featured all the usual - eggs, omelettes, fruit, oatmeal, etc. - plus some amazing Texas sausage and Tex-Mex favorites like huevos rancheros. There is also a nice steak restaurant here (Bob's Steak and Chop House). We took a walk through the Owner's Box sports bar and it was state-of-the-art and paid appropriate homage to Dallas sports teams past and present. Nice little gift shop too. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel, not prepared for sell out house”
Reviews.Author: eyetravel22
Reviews.Content: We visited the Omni due to it being the headquarters hotel for the University of Houston Alumni for the Ticket City Bowl Game on Jan.2, 2012. The Omni was sold out the night before for New Year's Eve and was not able to turn over clean rooms for the new group arriving. I had to wait over 2 hours (this was at 4PM not an early check in.) The front desk staff lower our rate during the first visit, then gave us free breakfast buffets after 2+ hours. The rooms are very nice with TV in the bathroom mirror. Refrigerator did not work. Everything was very clean and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: DeLosSantos2003
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of busy families I am trying to get out the door and I left my iPad in the room. I went make 9 hours later and they had it!! Can't beat a very honest and helpful staff!!! It was a very clean and friendly hotel!! We had volleyball tournament at the convention center and this was so convenient to stay here. We will be back for just a date night, such a great atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, new hotel adjacent to the convention center (connected by a skywalk). Room very nicely decorated, with some interesting touches, including a TV in the bathroom mirror and a motion-activated nightlight installed under the bed nightstand. Prior to your visit, sign up online for Omni's rewards program and get expedited check-in, free wifi and free coffee delivered to your room each morning (each evening you can specify when you want the coffee to be delivered -- nice). Fitness room is excellent, with treadmills, ellipticals, weights, etc. Excellent sports bar in the hotel; also, Bob's Steakhouse in the hotel is pricey, but their filet is excellent (it's not just another hotel restaurant -- apparently there are other well-known locations in Dallas and elsewhere); there's another restaurant and a coffee shop that I didn't try. No public transportation to/from the airport so everyone in my group took taxis. A short walk to the "grassy knoll" and Texas Book Depository if you're interested in the history of JFK's assassination. The only problem during my (and apparently everyone's) stay that week was they had major problems with their cable or satellite TV; the TV hardly worked during my entire stay. Overall, an excellent new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: candilturner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in December 2011. I thought the room was great. It was clean, large, and perfectly decorated. The only problem we had was initially our key cards did not work for our room, but once notified the hotel staff quickly fixed our problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are going to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: behindeverycloud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new and very pretty, outside and inside. If you are attending meetings at the Convention Center this is the place to stay, as it is connected via a skywalk. I still find it disappointing when one has to pay for wi-fi (although you could sign up to be a rewards member and then get wireless free, but why make this such a big deal). One night we were charged for valet parking when we self-parked every night, so that was weird. Also no vending machines. If you want a soda after 9 pm when the gift shop closes, you are out of luck. But the concierge did give me a little bottle for free when I asked where the machines were and she told me there weren't any. That was really nice! I just think a vending machine or two would have been no big deal, either. Why not have them? I think because it is so new folks who work there are still getting in a pattern, so I bet it will be a lot better as time goes on. The folks who worked the parking garage were super nice as were the room service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mario F
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip. Nice stay at this new hotel. Ernesto from the valet was very helpful. Enjoyed the lights and everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are in town for conference at te convention center”
Reviews.Author: okdds
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel, sky bridge into convention center (so we didn't even have to brave the cold winter weather) , excellent service . Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling new property”
Reviews.Author: matinee72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a work conference at the adjacent convention center. The Omni is sparkling, friendly, and rather posh with its room furnishings. I had a double queen on the 22nd floor with floor-to-ceiling views to west. The room was well appointed with superior towels, bathrobes, hi-def flat panel, motion-activated floor light between the beds, and even a TV display built into the bathroom mirror. Interior walkway to convention center and just steps away from a DART station. Staff was very friendly, too. Visited the sports bar but none of the other eateries within.

Reviews.Title: “Will be great hotel when they have more experience”
Reviews.Author: libser
Reviews.Content: The Omni Dallas (at the convention center) is a gorgeous hotel both inside and out. I understand that I was part of the first convention group that has used this hotel so they're still doing their "shake down" cruise. However, they need to ramp it all up more quickly than it is now. Good points: Great customer service lovely lobby TV in bathroom mirror (!) quiet rooms fast elevators great ambience good business center Points that REALLY need to be worked on: Lighting in hotel room is abysmal. I know it's a green hotel but very hard to work in or even navigate the hotel room with the lighting. I heard many, MANY people talk about this on the elevator. ... Speaking of the elevator, if I had to hear that cheery elevator quasi british/australian voice say "going up" or "going down" one more time, I was going to go postal. I would have gladly had the elevator plummet to the ground rather than hear that voice one more time. I wasn't the only one complaining, it was THE talk of whomever was in the elevator at any given time Only 2 little towel hooks in the bathroom-no towel bars. If you REALLY want to follow green guidelines, you need someplace to hang your towels up so they don't get washed daily. This is especially important if you are sharing the room with a non-family member. The hooks couldn't hold a wash cloth without it falling off. The water in the shower was never CLOSE to being as hot as the bathroom faucet. I complained about this 3 times and the water only got marginally better. Nowhere near the heat of the faucet. I think this could be solved by taking off the shower faceplate and moving the heat off the safety setting. The customer service was great in both the hotel and restaurants, but the timeliness of getting food ordered, receiving it, getting a bill, having the bill picked up etc. etc was frankly lousy. MAJOR training needs to occur for the food servers, busser's etc. The hotel employees also need to know the hotel better. I was waiting for a friend who said they were in the bar. When I went into the sports bar and didn't see them, the hostess told me they were the only bar in the hotel. WRONG, there are 4. Took me another 10 minutes of wondering and several texts until I found my friends. The housekeeper didn't know where the fitness room was, the business center employee didn't know you could pay and print off usps labels in the business center and then just take the mail down to the front desk to be sent out via usps NO SIDEWALKS! You either walk on the very busy driveways or you walk thru grass

Reviews.Title: “New Omni Hotel - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: monkeyfrog12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Omni in Dallas the week before Xmas for my 40th Birthday - it was amazing!! As we were driving towards Dallas the hotel stands out against the skyline with a light show worthy of the Vegas strip!! My father had pre booked 2 rooms, and checkin was speedy and efficient - valet very friendly! In our room the hotel had left a birthday cake and card signed by all the staff on the front desk, which was a lovely surprise. The rooms are great - huge comfortable beds, beautiful chic decor and even a TV in the mirror in the bathroom!! All staff we came across were friendly, efficient and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is new, and all areas just about perfect. We even managed to use the pool area on our second morning - which I imagine will be great in the summer - we had a cold frosty morning but the hot tub was great!! I must make a special mention to Hussein who was around ALL the time in the restaurants and bars, and made our time there very special. The sports bar is great with HUGE screens and every sport you can imagine being shown, and the restaurant where breakfast is served was fantastic - we had breakfast both mornings we were there, and a meal on my birthday - which was great! My step mom is a vegan and they specially prepared a meal for her - in fact anything we asked for we got! We will definitely be recommending this hotel and returning in the summer - we would have loved to stay for longer! Thankyou Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Good access to convention center”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and it was great. Convenient access to the center via the walkway made getting to meetings easy. The area is a bit removed from restaurants and nightlife. In the evening, they roll up the sidewalks and the surrounding area is quite abandoned, so plan on taking taxis to get anywhere interesting

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown option”
Reviews.Author: KBizzle612
Reviews.Content: After being in the Dallas suburbs for Christmas 2011, my fiancÃ© and I stayed at the new Omni for a night downtown and a Stars game. The service was excellent, and they helped us coordinate cabs to and from the game. We were very happy with our 4th floor room, especially since our room had a beautiful outdoor patio space! The room service menu was great. We ordered a late-night pizza, which turned out to be a wood-fired pizza with a lot of flavor (much better than I would have expected from room service). The only negatives: zero vending machines offered in the hotel (so even a soda requires room service fees and charges) and the downtown area isn't terribly safe in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is new and the service is superb. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. It's a huge hotel servicing a conference crowd (which is not why I was there) and I suppose it has the potential to be crowded but I didn't really feel it on my overnight stay. We had dinner at Bob's Steak & Chop House and breakfast at Texas Spice and both were excellent experiences all around though we did have to wait 10 minutes for at table at breakfast. The guest room is moderately sized and nicely furnished. The bathroom has a TV in the mirror (see the photo) and a huge shower, the kind with no doors (but no bathtub). Free wifi in the room for loyalty club members (joining is free so why not?). I printed out my boarding pass at the business center, which actually has a receptionist and is fully equipped with Apple computers. The hotel is a bit removed from the downtown area but there is a fleet of sedans waiting to drive you within 2 miles of the hotel for free. I was very impressed with the hotel around. Not only is it new, management is definitely making an effort to provide an exceptionally high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - 50/50”
Reviews.Author: Mycashisgoodenough
Reviews.Content: Clean and simply beautiful...but outside the room, I was not sure if they were racist or just no people skills. I went to check in and was told they had no rooms. I had just spoken to someone in their office from my cell phone, when i mentioned this...wala...a room became available. After making reservations, I was told they were still cleaning the rooms. The person next to me was offered their keys while they wait, so I asked for mine, and was told no. While I waited for my room, I again called the in hotel phone to ask if they had any rooms available, I was told yes. Mind you, it's nearly 5pm...you either have rooms or you don't. 1 1/2 later i go back to the counter to see if my room was ready...it was, so I asked the clerk if they had anymore rooms...he said yes. Anyway, I stayed in the room the entire time...paid over $300 to be insulted...

Reviews.Title: “Omni is a jewel in the Dallas skyline”
Reviews.Author: buellwinkle2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, up there with 5 star hotels I've stayed at. Don't know what to say, it's about 2 months old so obviously everything was clean, working and in perfect condition. I had a view of the Hyatt and that's a lousy view. If you can get a view towards the core of downtown and see the pickle building, their landmark pegasus building, it would be worth asking for. At night the building light up with bands of multicolor lights. You can drink yourself under the table and you will still find this hotel. More of a Vegas showpiece than an urban hotel. I did look and look, but no casino. I used the gym and the equipment is great and the views of downtown awesome, TV screens built into the cardio equipment. Look more like a gym in a modern residential hi-rise rather than what passes off as a gym at most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, needs some work on service”
Reviews.Author: dh301
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new OMNI convention center hotel the week of January 8, 2012. The hotel is gorgeous...the room was spacious and decorated very nicely and high end. The bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to leave it in the morning! One neat feature was a floor light that was motion activated, so if you had to get up in the middle of the night you could see where you were going. Genius! The bad news....the service on many fronts was not good. When we arrived, a guy stepped forward to pick up our bags from the trunk of the taxi and promptly retreated. Not sure why, but our taxi driver heaved them out, grumbling the entire time. We had dinner at the sports bar one evening and there were four of us dining. They got half the meals wrong in one way or another. There was a mini bar in the room, but it was not stocked (price list was there, just no products). I ordered two beers from room service, and 45 minutes and one phone call later, they finally arrived. We had a group staying at the hotel and many reported similar things happening with meal service and other amenities. Staying at a new hotel you kind of expect them to take a little time to work the bugs out, but this is an OMNI...a chain that you would expect to run as smooth as silk. The bathroom was lovely, with a TV embedded in the mirror, but pretty much right in the middle which was a little annoying but I worked around it. I would've expected a grip rail in the tub but there was none. The shower was OK...I've stayed at lower end hotels that had more water pressure. There is in room coffee service but they did not fully stock everything each day I was there. Again, hit or miss service. Bottom line....overall I would say the experience was good, but just be forewarned you may have some issues with food or room service. Maybe things will run smoother the longer the hotel is open.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed With Our New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D Dawn K
Reviews.Content: Everything here is brand new, so you expect a lot, and it doesn't disappoint! Our experience with the valets (very nice, professional), front desk, concierge, and gift shop were all positive. Everyone is helpful and friendly. The rooms are done really well with the art (you can buy it if you want), and the floor-to-ceiling windows. Rooms are generally large, too, and have all the amenities you would expect or need on a business trip. They have great room service options, a nice wine/beer list, and easy touch phone service for questions. The pool deck area is really great - especially at night when the neon colorful lights light up the whole deck while you're viewing the downtown skyline. A nice touch. The pool bar wasn't open (obviously, off-season), so there's no bar service at the pool now, but you can bring your own when you use the hot tub or heated pool. Overall, very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Omni is my new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: bayang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni 1/13/2012 - 1/15/2012 in Room 517 while attending a business conference. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by Brandon - a very friendly doorman who offered his assistance with anything. My husband and I got ready to stand in line to check-in but within a few seconds was greeted by another employee (sorry, I didn't catch his name) who gave us our room key. I had requested an early check-in and they delivered! We bypassed the line and went directly to our luxurious room. I loooove the smell of the room and the entire hotel!!... like fresh laundry. Our morning beverages were delivered on time each day. The last night we were there, we were served room service by Tonya who works two jobs and had only 1 hour of sleep that day! We were impressed by her positive and upbeat attitude despite being sleep deprived. Omni... be sure to give kudos to her and to Brandon (mentioned earlier). The beds were super comfortable; furnishings plush. Cool hidden TV in the bathroom mirror and you won't stumble in the dark.. as soon as your feet hit the floor, a light comes on near the floor and lights the way for you. I will be traveling to St. Louis for business soon and look forward to the same excellent experience at the Omni Majestic there.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel an asset to downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: TexasStarshine
Reviews.Content: Shortly after the Omni opened its new downtown Dallas convention center location, hubby and I landed a very reasonable online rate for an overnight stay one week before Christmas. As if the hotel decor itself wasn't eye-popping enough (floating crystal "chandelier" and "wall of fire" in the lobby), there was a stack of giant-sized Christmas balls on the lawn outside that lent an additional festive air to the pulsating variegated neon stripes on the exterior of the building.
