The room was elegant and had nice touches like a tv embedded in the bathroom vanity mirror and a tiny floor light beside the bed that would turn on whenever my feet were about to touch the floor in the dark. When we returned to the hotel at 11:00 that night, we had hoped to find a lobby bar to listen to live music; however, the only option was a very crowded and loud sports bar. That was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, it was a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in-town Sports Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer1961
Reviews.Content: I have lived in the Dallas area for slightly over 30 years. My husband and I travel extensively and have enjoyed many upscale experiences. For Christmas 2011 my husband asked for an 'in-town' Dallas Sports Experience. I looked for a weekend where we could attend a Dallas Mavs and Stars game. Decided to spend the night at the new Omni and it exceeded expectations! Everything from the time we drove up - the valet check-in of our car - the check-in at the desk - the beautiful 20th floor room with a truly impressive view of the Dallas skyline was spectacular! The concierge arranged a Lincoln Town Car to the game on Friday night. EASY cab ride back and dinner at Bob's Steak and Chop House (have the 12 oz rib eye!) - art in the hotel is beautiful, room is impressive (comfy, clean, friendly and some truly up-scale features - I don't want to spoil the surprise - but you truly have a magic mirror!) , service is friendly and impressive - makes me proud (all over again) that I moved to Texas!!!! Go Mavs and Stars - go Omni - go DALLAS!!!

Reviews.Title: “good n bad”
Reviews.Author: notnecessary
Reviews.Content: There's good news and bad news for groups staying at this convention center hotel. First the good: the hotel is new, rooms very nice, bedding plush, staff polite. Bad news: very understaffed. Over a holiday weekend with two separate, consecutive, events at the hotel the housekeeping staff was slow to turn the rooms, resulting in some arriving guests not being accomodated until 9 pm. This is a huge convention hotel with many rooms. Such a delay should be unfathonable. Likewise the food/beverage manager was way behind. The main steakhouse was closed on Sunday, leaving only the Sports Bar and hotel restaurant for dining. We made a reservation but still waited an hour and a half in the restaurant after ordering, still no food. We tried room service, delay was hour and a half. Ate pizza in the sports bar, which was wall to wall people due to a pro football game being broadcast. After speaking to a manager our room was comped, very nice. But staffing issue was never addressed. Those planning large group meetings or convention type use should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best urban hotel I've stayed at on the last five years.”
Reviews.Author: rbaron721
Reviews.Content: Service was great, the rooms were well appointed and clean, the restaurant was great. Not sure what worse you could ask for out of a hotel. I usually don't like staying at hotels this big, but the service quality was like that of a boutique hotel. The exterior light display is interesting as you pull up to the valet. Just like the high tech rooms, it's mesmerizing. The feature I liked the best in the rooms was the floor that lit up when you stepped out of your bed, guiding you to your destination when it's dark. The rooms were quite and comfortable and very large with a little seating area right by the window. Ask for a room with a view of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, all around!”
Reviews.Author: marcene0219
Reviews.Content: The new Omni Hotel & Convention Center in downtown Dallas, Texas lives up to the hype. Stayed here as part of a group travel plan and the staff were all extremely accommodating. The room (Deluxe King) was fantastic, bed & shower especially. What I also can't say enough about are the in hotel restaurants. You must visit Texas Spice during your stay, and the Owner's Bar is a first class sports bar. Loved every minute and will stay here from now on when I visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Ticket City Bowl stay”
Reviews.Author: Chaille
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for the Ticket City Bowl - go Coogs! Our experience was incredible and it was a great host hotel. We utilized the online check-in which was quick and easy, but without talking to the front desk, we didn't know how to turn anything on in the room because it is key-controlled. Technological conveniences! Beautiful modern hotel, comfortable room (the bed was fantastic), TV built into the mirror in the bathroom(not that we used it), courteous service and professional staff. Some people complained about the New Year's Eve "Rave" and the hotel being understaffed, but we didn't experience any of that. We were very pleased with everything and were treated very well. Breakfast room service was on time; the sports bar was crowded, but fun and the sweet and spicy wings were yummy; and breakfast at the restaurant was excellent. We had at least 2 people waiting and checking on us in both the sports bar and the restaurant. Can't beat the attention. Elevators were fast and there was never a wait. The only problem we had was the wifi charge on our bill because I am a Select Guest member, but I only had to mention it at the front desk, and it was taken care of. We will definitely stay again if we revisit Dallas and we highly recommend this new downtown Omni Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel for the Houston COOGS!”
Reviews.Author: MAXnANGEL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The staff was inundated with COOG Fans there for the Ticket City Bowl on New Years Day. I heard that the New Years Eve guests had attempted to trash the hotel the night before. The staff worked diligently to get everything ready for our arrival. Our friend received a complimentary Suite that was unbelievable! My husband and I will request this room on our next visit. The Box sports bar was a ball. The BED!!! The bed was really comfortable and the pillows were perfect. I'm really picky about hotel beds and this one is my new favorite. I loved the tv built into the bathroom mirror. We received prompt room service and check out was a breeze. We lost our valet ticket twice but the guys retrieved our car just as fast and didn't make a big deal out of it. We provided the correct information to verify it was our vehicle. Definately a hotel we will revisit. The staff was under enormous pressure and they were always polite.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: Timberlynn O
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest friendliest hotels we have stayed at. The staff was really helpful and friendly... It was a wonderful experience. I do not have one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Lamar Street”
Reviews.Author: Sad S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a one night stay. The management at this hotel is simply horrible!!!! Management has no idea on how to accomodate the needs of any guest. From the valet, to the bellman, to the sports bar personnel to the reception staff has been taught by management to engage in "hotel speak," which is a form of dialect totally based upon on dishonesty and deception. I arrived at 3:30 and was told my room was not ready!!! At 4:30 my room was still not ready. It was only after I asked for my money back did all of a sudden my room become available. I am not a high maintenance, overly demanding guest but simply demand clean accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Be mindful of "turndown" service”
Reviews.Author: iknowwhatisnice
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels. I have never heard of a hotel coming in your room at night to fix the bed (that you are about to sleep in) while you are gone. Yes I know the rule about putting the do not distrub sign on the door if u don't want/need housekeeping but never knew I had to put it out before we head out to a party at night. Be mindful of that "for select guest" when headed out. Other than that surprise when we returned at 2 in the morning, everything was great

Reviews.Title: “TVs in the Bathroom - SOLD!”
Reviews.Author: jacmartol
Reviews.Content: Came down to Dallas with a friend to see the Cowboys play. This hotel had only been open for a month (opened Nov 13) so everything was very posh and new. My room was amazing. I was on the front side (facing Lamar St) The floor to ceiling windows are great and I had a lovely view of downtown dallas. The opposite side of the hotel is the highway, so the view might not be as spectacular. We had Starbucks when we arrived - complimentary in the lobby. (Again, this might be a Saturday thing only - it wasn't there on Sunday) But they also have a Starbucks and a deli inside, a small gift area with some expensive/lavish items, and an awesome Sports bar. My only issue - which was very small - my room key wasn't working for the garage, so I had to keep explaining to the people standing outside the parking garage that I was a guest at the hotel. I think this is solely because they are a new hotel and they don't have all the kinks worked out just yet. Check in was very fast though. Parking a night is like $20 - fyi. The infinity pool outside is great - and had a great view of the city. It was winter so no one was swimming - but the pool area looks like a really nice place to be during the summer. It's on the very end - outer end of downtown - so it's a bit of a walk to Midtown or Main St where there are quite a view restaurants and bars. Hands down - the best part of the hotel - are the TVs in the mirror in the bathroom. I got to listen to ESPN and NFL while I was in the shower or getting ready. It was amazing. The beds were very comfortable as well. Overall, if I could get this hotel for the same rate I got it for (they were running a grand opening special) I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - impressed”
Reviews.Author: davuda
Reviews.Content: Was in Dallas for business and stayed at the Omni. This hotel really stands out. The hotel opened in November 2011 and the design was really well thought out. The entire hotel is very stylish and modern. Staff is very well trainned and provided exceptional service. For example, I arrived about alittle prior to my room being ready (was listed cleaned - but not inspected) - the registration staff offered me a complimentary drink in the lobby area bar. About 1/2 hr later, he called me and brought my key to me. Staff throughout our meeting was really attentive. My room was exceptionally decorated and comfortable. Clean modern lines and artwork. Bathroom came with a hidden TV in the mirror. Bathrobe was very complimentary. The rooms are also green - you need your room key to turn on lights and most electrial outlets. The workout facility well equipped with treadmills, ellipiticals (two types of Precor), free weights and weight machines. There is an infinity pool - weather was really cold when I was there and didn't go outside much. Food was really-really good. Ate at Texas Spice - food and drink was great. We had conference buffet style food for the rest of the meeting - all was surprisingly good. Overall, I'm a fan of Omni hotels because of their expectional service. This one stands out among the many other Omni's that I've stayed at (including SF, NYC) and among other top flight facilites like the Four Seasons and Fairmount

Reviews.Title: “Awesome New Omni Hotel; opened 11/11/11”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNJFam5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Omni Hotel on S Lamar st. with some buddies during the Dallas-Giants game the weekend of 12/10-12. The rooms were extremely comfortable and well designed. Flat screen TVs, including one in the mirror of the bathroom, nicely decorated, window view facing downtown Dallas. They also have a great sports bar with PLENTY televisions, two pool tables and lounge chairs, in addition to three other restaurants. They have an outdoor heated pool and jacuzzi with a ice bar; a business center for computer use (for a fee), and convenient store. Note: they charge $25 per day for valet parking and $18 per day for self parking :( other than that, I really enjoyed my stay at this Omni and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mstoymal
Reviews.Content: Went to the Omni Dallas Hotel on a Saturday for a stay-cation, Iâ€™m from Dallas so me and some girlfriends decided to have a girlâ€™s night out. Arrived at 3:35pm, self parked, which there is a daily fee. There is also valet parking. There were a lot of people in the lobby checking in, but there were enough front desk clerks so check-in was a breeze, it took all of 3 minutes. The young lady gave me my room keys and told me that I would need to place one key in the holder next to the door once I entered the room to basically power up the room. Also wanted to mention, there was a table set up in the lobby with free Starbucks hot cider and fresh cookies. The elevators were easy to find and I didnâ€™t have to wait long. The room I got was a double queen on the 22nd floor. The room was really nice and luxurious and the view of downtown Dallas was awesome with the floor to ceiling windows. Something nice worth mentioning, there was a personalized message on the television when I entered the room, a welcome greeting with my name, nice touch. Nice features included flat screen hdtv, free wifi, large desk area, two bathrobes, mini fridge and safe, large tub/shower, tv in the bathroom mirror, comfy beds. The dÃ©cor was really nice, there was beautiful canvas and framed artwork in the rooms and all over the hotel. Checked out the pool terrace/spa/fitness room on the 4th floor, which was really nice. The pool is outside and it was cold when I was there but the pool is heated (stuck my hand in the water to check) and there also was a hot tub. There was a bar (which was closed, maybe due to the chilly temperature outside) and comfy seating available. We had heard that this was a place where we could hang out, have drinks and listen to music but it was pretty much shut down and that was a bit disappointing. The sports bar was pretty busy, we tried to get seated around 9pm but there was an hour and half wait, so we went outside the hotel...we had a pretty large party and the hostess told us that we should call ahead in the future. So if you have a large party, call ahead. Overall, the hotel is very nice. It has a modern touch to it but it is extremely comfy. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I would definitely stay again and hope too soon. There were a couple of things worth mentioning that bothered me a little, but nothing so serious as to make me stay away. The drain in the bathtub is very slow almost like it was clogged. Thought that was strange for a brand new hotel. Also, the room doors don't really "self latch", you have to make sure you pull the door shut every time you leave or enter. Not a big deal just took us a little while to remember to do it, since we are so used to most doors closing and latching by themselves

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Convention Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicago2socal
Reviews.Content: I was with a large group of well traveled industry executives who was able to experience the hotel within its first week of opening. You could tell the hotel ready for us as the staff was a mix of new employees and .experienced managers from other properties. The public areas are full of local artwork which is a refreshing idea. This hotel is very concerned with it's impact on the environment, so you will see many of the LEEDS type of initiatives present. I would have to say, this is one of the better hotels to be connected to a convention center. Now all the city needs to do is completely renovate the Dallas Convention center which is old and tired. AVT audio visual is in house and they did an awesome job with our meeting. They are the premier AV company to have in a hotel environment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeMySamaritan
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is really quite nice. The rooms are huge with expansive views of downtown Dallas. The colorful room decor is probably the best I've seen at any hotel including any 5-start resort hotel. The restaurants are top-notch and the service impeccable. One of the best experiences I've had in a long time. The only thing I'd like to see is bottled water in the rooms. Otherwise, A++.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful rooms I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Mai N
Reviews.Content: OMNI DALLAS -- A truly captivating hotel. I loved the ambiance of this hotel. Only disappointment was the romance package execution. I had to call a few times to remind the concierge/front desk. Anyways, the new hotel and the staff is still learning (trial & error). I'm glad the staff did hear me out though. For future reference... just make sure you call concierge or front desk to double check that it gets done for any special requests. Since there were a handful of issues this stay, I knocked off a star. Other than that, it's a pretty close to a 5 star. THE HOTEL: clean, new, LOVED the brand new scent DELUXE ROOM: select guests get a customized room. I LOVED THE HOTEL ROOM. Comfy beds, soooo clean and new! The artwork was pretty awesome. Bathrooms were spacious and the tv in the mirror was just genius! RESTAURANTS - Owner's Box: probably one of the coolest sports bars I've been to. plenty of projecter screens and tvs. 2 pool tables in the far back. A reallly good happy hour is available EVERYDAY! 3-7pm. $2.50 bud lights and $4 house margaritas and buy one appetizer get one free! Nachos and potato skins are pretty tasty! - Texas Spice: what a vast array of breakfast items for you to choose from! I loved the wall of pastries/bread/croissants/jams. The whole decor and set up was very rustic. SERVICE - Since this is a new hotel, there were some minor requests that did not happen so I had to call the front desk/concierge. They were understaffed and I"m sure they were still learning. Hopefully this wont happen my next stay. SELF PARKING $18

Reviews.Title: “Wow- a new Dallas gem!”
Reviews.Author: iluv2goaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a huge event last weekend. The rooms were so clean and the bathrooms were remarkable. I was amazed by the television in the mirror. This new hotel is a great addition to the surrounding area. I tried to book a room for new years eve, but they are already full!! I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Omni, a few opening jitters but great in general”
Reviews.Author: TripFan045
Reviews.Content: Being from Dallas, I don't stay in area hotels all that often, but with all the hub bub surrounding the new Omni and their opening rate specials, we figured we would try it out for a night. The hotel is nice, new and shiney, I liked the feel of the main lobby area. We also took the escalators up to walk around the open common areas by some of the hotel conference rooms. It was also very nice. It would be a great place to have a conference. The rooms were new and nice as well. pretty high tech when it came to a tv in the bathroom mirror and the room welcoming you when you first arrive. We got a room with a view of the city, and knowing Dallas, I would recommend that over a view facing the other direction if you have a choice. The hotel is next to the convention center and set off a few blocks from the bulk of downtown which actually allows for some pretty cool views of the Dallas skyline and none of the rooms should really have blocked views, although higher is still better. There were three main restaurants that we saw in the hotel. One is Texas Spice which is supposedly local ingredients that come from within 200 miles. Not entirely sure what the menu genre is though. Also there is a sports bar called the Owner's Box which was really neat and had a great feel. Tons of giant TVs. We went in and had a drink before dinner. The drinks were very reasonably priced for a brand new hotel sports bar. The other restaurant is the Bob's steakhouse in the hotel which is where we had dinner. Bob's is one of the oldest and most famous steakhouses in Dallas and now they have a couple locations besides their original on Lemmon Avenue. It is a nice and expensive restaurant. The food was really good and truthfully better than I remember it being at other Bob's locations. The feel of the restaurant was nice. The oddity was the restrooms. To go to the restroom as a restaurant patron, you have to leave the restaurant and walk half way across the main lobby to the common hotel lobby restrooms. For a ground up new construction, someone should be fired for making this happen. In some places that are historic or older, it is kind of quirky and fun that the restrooms are tucked away in an odd places becuase of a strange remodel, but for a very nice resturant in a brand new hotel to have to walk what seems like the distance of a football filed to go to the restroom is ridiculous. The location of the hotel is on the least developed side of downtown Dallas, which the powers that be hope will help spur development in that direction. It is walkable to the main parts of downtown (Main Street, the West End, Dealy Plaza,Victory, etc), but depending on where you are going, the weather, etc, it is also a very short cab ride and you won't be missing anything along the way. I would probably say walk if you are going to Dealy Plaza or the Nieman's on Main Street, but take a cab if you are going to the American Airlines Center or the Arts District. I think this hotel will serve the convention business very well. It would also be a good option if you want a nice hotel in or near downtown. If you are going very high end on a hotel, I would recommend, the Mansion, the Crescent or the Ritz, but it you are going one half star less, or are coming to Dallas for business, than the Omni would be a pretty good option.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, new modern Omni”
Reviews.Author: islasisterchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night over Thanksgiving weekend. As I am a Omni Platinum select guest, I automatically got upgraded to the 18th floor. What a view! The service isn't quite up to Omni standards yet, but I'll give them a little slack as they had only been open for 12 days. Check in was quick, but I had really already checked-in online so all I had to do was pick up my key. The hotel was busy due to the Turkey trot 10K the next day. The decor is very cool and cosmopolitan, lots of travertine and cool fireplaces everywhere. The sports bar is awesome-huge screens and TVs on every open space and an upscale crowd. If you can't see the game you want to watch, you must be blind. The rooms are small for an Omni, but very nice. My husband loved the TV in the bathroom mirror. I thought I'd never get him out of there. The pool on the 4th floor roof top is divine. It was heated, but too cold for me when its 50 degrees out. My hubby loved it. I stayed in the hot tub and watched the sun set over the Dallas skyline. Lovely. Of course, it's off-season for the pool, so the huge pool bar was closed and we had to hunt down towels for the pool. Unusual, as normally Omni staff would have them on all the chairs regardless of time of year. We ordered room service for breakfast and the crunchy french toast was incredible. Food was hot on arrival and right on time. Kudos to the room service staff! Front desk staff was incredible. The sports bar seemed understaffed and overwhelmed. But the TVs kept us occupied while waiting. I was disapppointed that there wasn't someone opening the front door for us and offering to assist with bags on arrival. That is very strange not to have that at an Omni. Parking is $18/nt for self-park and $25 for valet. This is standard in any downtown area for hotel parking. Despite their opening month glitches, Omni still has the best hotels and service for the money in the world. Definitely go try this place out, it's awe-inspiring even if just in size.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: tripaj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a one night getaway. Pros: the hotel was beautiful and trendy. Fire pits, fountains, and all the indoor and outdoor furniture were great. the hot tub and pool can't be missed. as a 6 foot big guy i hate most hot tubs because i get in and stick halfway out or for some reason can't sit and enjoy it getting blown around by the jets. this tub was perfect. while you sit outdoor you get entertained by the ever changing colors of the building--not for everyone but i liked it a lot. the room was great. a "green room" where you have to power it on with your key which was entertaining. didn't seem worth it but the word "green" makes some people swoon i suppose. bathroom was very cool, romantic even. same as the room. attached are great restaurants (by appearance as we didn't take the time to dine). if we didn't live so far away this would be a very regular get away for my wife and i. cons: being on hold for ten minutes before we got to the hotel, not a big deal but who enjoys being put on hold? lastly, and this is something i could have changed but i didn't know it at the time: the pillows. the pillows were down filled and thin. not my cup of tea. parking was $18 a night. unavoidable as far as i know but still not a reason to praise the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive LUXURY with a Spectacular View”
Reviews.Author: NaNuet23
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday. We were quite pleased in the brand new contemporary style that yet had a warm comfy feel to it. There are many major interstates nearby, so the location is awesome for commuting to almost anywhere in Dallas & the surrounding areas. Even though the hotel is located downtown, it happens to be on a less congested block & is easily assessable. Valet parking is $25 a day & self-parking is $17 day, this is pretty standard for the luxury of staying in downtown Dallas, so plan accordingly. The convention center is connected to the hotel for you conventioneers convenience. We stayed in a room on the 9th floor with a spectacular view of downtown. Downtown is best seen at night once all the lights are gleaming. The hotel also has lights all around it, so take a nice stroll, save your money & stay in a standard suite. The beds are oh soO comfortable, which is much needed after enjoying all the charms of Dallas. Room service is available 24hrs a day and if I might add that grilled chicken sandwich was on point at 3:30am when every other place was closed ;) Oh, Wi-Fi is free too! Ummmmâ€¦I guess Iâ€™ll end with the note that many hotels in Dallas claim to be luxurious, but you will find they are quite dated & expensive, so no need to research any furtherâ€¦this hotel is for sure the NEW HOT spot!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Dallas New But needs help!”
Reviews.Author: Kent B
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the new Omni Dallas thinking it would be a great place to experience. We stayed at other Omni Hotels and this one did not compare to others. Service if you can get it ,staff need a lot more training and they need twice the staff and I hope your bath room gets cleaned. I will say the rooms are nice and maybe they will get it together soon. They did apologize and offer an up grade the next time we consider staying in Dallas Omni.

Reviews.Title: “It's tough to open a new property!”
Reviews.Author: barbsmb
Reviews.Content: Our group was the very first group to use the Omni-being in 'the business', we understand there are things that will happen on the opening show. There were things, but the staff was on top of it and handled it as they came. My room had an issue upon check in, but engineering arrived in not time and it was fixed. They had a computer glitch during checkout that locked us out of the room, but they dispatched staff and security to get us all back in quickly so we could depart (they had given us all late check out). The food was good, the meeting rooms/ballrooms lovely, and staff was very accommodating. Extremely convenient to the convention center as well.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Major Improvement....Fast!!!”
Reviews.Author: TMoff
Reviews.Content: For this to be a hotel only opened for two weeks, we were not impressed. For starters, we checked in at 3:00pm and had to wait over an hour before the room we reserved weeks in advance was ready. The front desk personnel was nice and attempted to accommodate us which was great. We decided to stay a second day and OMG were we disappointed. We went out for breakfast and came back and there were several Valets around but we did not get assistance. My husband had to circle back around before anyone came to over to our car. Later that night, I ordered a hot dog from room service. It was cold and the bun was toasted so hard that it had broken into two pieces. Also, that night the people across the hall were having a party. The walls are so thin and we could hear music and every conversation. Security came and we could hear their conversation with the loud party. Even after security left, the music was gone but we could still hear talking. We noticed that we could hear people walking by the night before but didn't think anything of it. Needless to say, we ended up leaving. The hotel again, did attempt to accommodate us but it was too late. We were done!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but overall a real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mustang-five
Reviews.Content: I will start by acknowledging that the hotel and Texas Spice restaurant are new, so kinks were expected. But beware that they are plentiful. First, the overall operation seems understaffed--frankly, I expected the opposite during the first week of operations. We arrived to learn that our room wasn't ready. The carpet on our floor desperately needed to be vaccuumed. It looked the same when we left the next day. The room was nice, but there were cracker crumbs next to the bed and painter's tape on the window. Theme: little things add up. The Texas Spice Restaurant was so disappointing I'm not sure where to begin. Inattentive service, staff walking around chatting with each other instead of attending to their jobs, total lack of preparedness (How do you not have a listed bottle of wine in stock during the first week? Or the second, different bottle that we ordered??), luke warm and flavorless food (cheese grits and hanger steak, I'm talking about you)--and it wasn't even crowded. They "re-heated" and re-served the steak (and thankfully took it off the bill). We laughed a lot, but mostly because the compilation of errors reached a comical level (of sorts). As a Dallas native, and knowing that this hotel and restaurant will receive many of our future visitors, I truly hope the Omni and Texas Spice work hard to prove my initial review a temporary one. There is a lot to be done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel, but they have service issues to work out!”
Reviews.Author: Becky M
Reviews.Content: BAM from Dallas . . . It was after 6pm on Saturday, November 19, we pulled up to the valet drive area and waited 10 minutes and no one came to take our car or assist with our luggage.We then went to the self parking area and parked our car and hauled our luggage into the hotel ourselves. After waiting 20 minutes we were assisted by an agent, very friendly, she said this was her first hotel to work at. I don't recall her name because her hair covered up the name tag. 903 was our room and we never were approached by a bellman to assist us with us luggage to our room. The room was nice, and still spelled new. I never could find a light on the desk area under the TV at night to read the newspaper. Lighting in the guestroom is very poor if you want to read your book or anything.The lighting needs alot of improvement. The hotel had a great view, which I loved.We came to see the tree lighting downtown, which was outstanding. We came back to the hotel afterwards, we have eaten at Bob's in Dallas, so decided to try the other restaurants, Texas Spice the wait was 45 min. at 8:45pm. We waited 1 hour and still no table. We asked the 2 nice young men hostesses how would they find us when our table was ready and they said they would come look for us but we would have to keep checking back with them. After 1 hour we went to the Owers Box and another 45 minute wait. We walked through the restaurant and found a three tables available inside and also outside there were alot of tables available.We sat outside but never got any service. It is very apparent that they need more servers. We left and went to the Westend to eat. We came back to the hotel after 11:15 pm and went to the pool area to relax, very nice atmosphere, they have a great bar area but no service?I would have loved a cocktail outside. . It was sad to see that the ppl that are staying there are not taking care of the hotel, as there was a wine glass inside the jacuzzi, beer bottles, and many towels left. This area needed to be serviced.Even though it was posted on the wall about the 5am-11pm time frame for the pool and jacuzzi, a portable sign put up to advise the guests that the area is closed at 11pm would be nice also. Security was very unfriendly about advising ppl to clear out of the jacuzzi/pool. In the guestrooms remember to keep your key in the electricity slot because being a Green hotel the lights will go off. We went back to the bar area inside the hoteland could not get serviceThe bathroom was not stocked with all the bathroom amenities, no bath soap and I prefer not to use bath gel,because there is not enough for 2 people to take a shower.I was not aware that I would not have a tub, as I prefer a tub to soak in after a workout in the fitness room.Wish the front desk agent would advise me of this.Loved the fitness room, but no place to put your towl when finished.The pool area is outstanding with the views. I love the fact that they are a green hotel, however, all the trash containers are still not marked with what slots are for what trash items.I'm certain this will be resolved soon.Loved the bill under the door and checked out via the computer screen.Went to Texas Spice to try the breakfast at 9am, but again a 45 minute wait.I hope to try their food on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the new Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherrie L
Reviews.Content: I am unsure where to start. We arrived at the hotel at 1 p.m. on Saturday Nov. 19, 2011. We went to check in and requested a balcony at the time we made reservations. They did not have that request on file but stated it was not a problem but the balcony rooms were not ready. We waited until 2:45 and the front desk phoned us to say our room was ready. We were in the Owner's Box Lounge waiting. We went to the desk the Bell Man carried up our luggage and we were given a room with no balcony. We phoned down to the desk and were told they would move us but the balcony rooms still were not ready. At 3:30, 4:oo, and 4:30 the room still was not ready. Finally, the room was available at 4:50. In the meantime, the hotel was holding our luggage. We got to our room and had to rush for a 5:30 reservation at Bob's Chop House. Once we rushed to shower and get dressed my husband went to get his White Shirt and it was gone. No one at the hotel did anything about it except to say, sorry we don't know what happened to it, we had a lot of luggage carts in the lobby with luggage due to rooms being unavailable so someone may have taken it by mistake and the Bell Man say's he don't have it. Well, that was a no brainer we never thought the bellman did have it. They did not check the original room we were placed in or even follow up with us. At check out, I inquired again about the shirt and what the hotel was going to do about it and again was just told, "Sorry". Being in the hotel industry I finally ask to complete the replacement value form and a girl come from Lost and Found and still we have heard nothing. I feel the hotel should comp me a room as the reason for our overnight stay was my birthday present/celebration. This was no celebration only one headache after the next. We were not even able to enjoy the balcony room as by the time dinner was complete it was going on 9:30. We had no time to enjoy our Champagne, Wine or anything else. Not being able to rest all day waiting on the room we were tired and went to bed. We ended up leaving the hotel at 7:30 a.m. on Sunday as to not ruin another day of our celebration weekend. I hope that we will hear from the Omni with some type of compensation and the replacement cost of a 100.00 shirt. Patiently waiting.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Some Good things, Some Areas Need Improvement....”
Reviews.Author: Tnglwdman817
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the new Omni Dallas, located downtown on Lamar. IT was exciting to be one of the first guests at this new convention center hotel. It was also a bit disappointing on a few levels. The hotel is new, and the staff if green, so I would hope improvement will come, and soon. The hotel opened ahead of schedule and has already had a couple of groups, one hosting over 700 rooms, so the business if off and running! Architect Design wise, the building is stunning. A new addition to dominate the Dallas skyline. The location is great, not just for conventions (it is connected to the convention center), but also being in downtown, you have easy access to most everything Dallas and the DFW area have to offer. The staff, in most areas, needs a lot more training. The hotel is new. Perhaps this is the first time for many to be working hospitality. Still, the attitude displayed in many departments (valet, bellman, front desk, restaurants, housekeeping, spa( all need improvement to be acceptable. My observations: The staff seems more interested in chatting with each other than watching out for the guests. Upon arriving and driving up to the valet entrance, I had to get out of the car, after waiting an several minutes, watching the valets talk amongst themselves to get attention and turn the vehicle over to them. This was after popping the trunk and making, or eye contact with two uniformed men. Finally, a girl valet came and gave me a ticket for the car, but no offer of assistance with luggage came until we had unloaded the car and walked to the door. Then the same girl asked if we wanted assistance. We could manage, and having gone this far, declined. We did struggle with the door, and after we got it opened and picked up our bags again, she held the door. Really too little too late. Hope this is just a training issue with new staff and not the way things will be on an ongoing basis. Not the best first impression. The chit chat amongst the staff continued at the front desk. We arrived shortly after 3:00 PM and there were no other people waiting to check in. As part of the reservstion process, I was able to "pre check in" on line, and was instructed to simply look for the key board to the right of the front desk, where my key would be waiting with my name on it. I was excited, and skeptical, about this service. I was concerned about security and :1) Could just anyone come and grab a key packet? and 2) would anyone be able to look and get names of people staying in the hotel, and perhaps room numbers, etc. This turned out not to be an issue as the key board is not set up yet, so I had to go the the desk. Two women wre talking about their plans for after work, and after a couple of minutes, stopped so one could assist me. The gent ws pleasant. She explained about the key board just not being ready yet, and since the hotel IS new, I can accept that. However, the reservation call center should be aware of this and sadvise upon making the reservation what the status is, and that an automated email will be sent offering a service that is just not quite ready yet. Oh well.... The agent did have all my information correct, which is refreshing. She also explained about the GREEN HOTEL, and in an effort to conserve resources, one has to place the room key in a special holder next to the door to power up the room, the electric outlets, the air conditioning, the television. Hummm......I am for not wasting resources, to an extent, but this sounded a little too controlling. I like to have some choice about what I might want to conserve, and when traveling, might want to luxuriate in a little flagrant indulgence. I asked for a third key so we could keep one in the power port at all times...IF we chose to. The agent complied. We made our way to the bank of elevators that took us to the top floor, 23, and found our room, 2355. I had reserved a king bed, and this room was a double double, but we decided not to make an issue and enjoy having a bed to ourselves. It is so exciting to be one of the first guests in a hotel. IT is exciting to try anything new! I like the style of the decor. Southwest elements are reflected in the color scheme, along with a contemporary design in the furniture and art work. The art is all about Dallas and Texas which is welcoming. The room was spacious enough, but seemed a bit odd in layout. There were two desk chairs, side by side, at the long credenza like motel console space: no free standing desk. IT seemed somewhat classroom style. Perhaps this was done with the idea of business/convention people sharing a room and giving individual albeit cramped, work space. My travel companion suggested perhaps the two chairs were for room service, when a travel table cart is left. There was an additional semi lounge chair by the window with a small table at the side. Also at this long credenza console was a bench. This came in handy as an ottoman for the chair, and I guess would substitute for a luggage bench as there was no bench in the closet should one care to place a suitcase on one. The mini bar, while present, was not stocked. At first we thought this was just something the hotel had not gotten around to, yet should for rooms placed in inventory. Later, while speaking with the concierge, we were told that there is a list where you can indicate what you want in the mini bar and it will be stocked for you. This is designed to cut down on disputed charges so often associated with the hotel mini bars, and to save labor hours if someone does no want a particular item, like alcohol in the room. Well and good if you are staying multiple days, which most convention goes will be, but not for the one night stay as we were. No five dollar coke to indulge this trip! The coffee bar is set up here with the mini bar, along with the very small ice bucket. There were two (2) glasses here. There were no glasses in the bathroom set up. Odd. Troublesome when I went to brush my teeth, and no glass to rinse with. The bathroom was well laid out, nice towels, nice amenities, including a jar with cotton balls, and a bathroom rug. Little touches like this make a big difference in comfort when traveling. The view from the room is spectacular. You see Dallas for all the grandeur it is! Floor to ceiling windows. There is a night light that automatically comes on located under the bed side table, which we really liked when we had to get up in the night. Upon entering the room, the televison was on with a personalized welcome message addressed to me. Nice touch. We found the television system a bit challenging to use however. Too high tech for us middle aged baby boomers not up on all the latest technology. I am sure the younger gereration will love this, along with the IPOD docking station. The room first seemed clean, but upon inspection, on the floor of the bathroom were three long hairs. Black. Now I am bald, with a shaved head, and my travel companion has brunette hair and had not been in the bathroom yet, so I knew these hairs were not from her. This does not speak well for housekeeping. Also, the bed linens, while clearly new, also looked fresh out of the package with creases where they had been folded. This will probably go away with laundering, but a little steaming or pressing would make a better impression. May sound petty, but just my observation. Are any of these issues a deal breaker for this hotel, for a repeat visit? No. But as an Omni brand, I would hope some changes (i.e. more glassware, stocked mini fridge, luggage bench) will be made. We went out for the evening to a party, and returned about 9:15 PM, hungry and looking forward to relaxing in the bar and having a late dinner. We thought surly the hotel restaurants would be open until 10:00 PM. But when we ventured into the Texas Spice restaurant located just off the lobby, which is the venue for breakfast, lunch and dinner, we were told the kitchen would be closing in 15 minutes, and there were two parties waiting for a table ahead of us. The unspoken implication was we would not be served. Could not be served. We looked around and saw many open tables, along with many dirty tables. We pressed and sked directly, can we be accommodated here for dinner or not. If not, just ay so and we will go elsewhere. The host said we could still have dinner, we just had to wait, as there were two parties ahead of us. Okay. We would go wait at the bar. The bar was crowded, no two seats together there. My companion suggested I sit and wait at the bar while she investigated what else the hotel might have to offer for food. I took a seat at the end of the bar, where I could observe some other diners and the several open tables. It seems we could have been seated at one of these emty tables, even if we had to wait to be served. We could have been studying the menu and be ready to place an order before the kitchen closed. The staff does not agree, wo here I am, waiting at the bar. N one comes to take a cocktail order. I make eye contact with the two people behind the bar. One female bar tender even comes and goes from behind the bar, greets me with a "how ya doing", but never offers to serve a beverage. I waited the 15 minutes the host advised it would be for a table, then cut my losses and made my way back, past the many open tables, to the host stand. Oh, and let me mention, while waiting, a man who appeared to be a manage, in a suit, asked, "was I waiting for a table" to which I replied "yes", but no response from him. He made his way to several of the empty tables, touched the tables, made his was toward the kitchen where uniformed staff (waiters? Bussers?) stood, chatting with each other again as we observes the staff on arrival, but doing no work. The manager sid this round of walking to the table, touching the table, walking to the staff by the kitchen, walking back to the tables, touching the tables, waking back to the staff, while managing to get nothing accomplished. So I go the the host, who is speaking with my companion, still not making an attempt t seat us, and we leave. We are both beginning to get provoked by the service, or the lack of any service here in the hotel, and decide to test the concierge out. The lady concierge on duty, a delightful and friendly young lady, was very calming and welcoming and presented some options, including the venue of Bob's Steak and Chop House. Bob's is a mainstay in Dallas, very good reputation with their original location in the Oak Lawn/Uptown area, and now opening on Omni hotels. It is now almost 10:00 PM, their closing time at Bob's, but the concierge telephones and speaks to the hostess and clears the way for us to be accommodated. She then comes around from behind the desk and escorts us to the dining room to make sure we are taken care of. VERY impressed, as I think most would have just given directions on where to go and be done with us. She talks about the hotel, the design, the art, the outlets with great enthusiasm. I is great to see an employee so excited about where they work, their job, their guests and their responsibilities. We are feeling better now with this attention, and once we reach the restaurant, she makes introductions to the hostess, who again seems genuinely pleased to have us, and they both escort us to a table in the bar area and make introductions to our server. We asked the concierge about the location of a breakfast meeting we are to attend in the hotel in the morning and confimring the times. Now she could have left a voice mail message on our room telephone, or slipped a note under the door, but instead, she found out the information and came back to the restaurant, to our table, and spoke to us in person! I was very, very impressed. I wish I could remember her name, as she is an excellent concierge. It started with an "M". She also spoke to the hostess and our server (which was Julie) to make sure things were going well. Things at this point were going very, very well. Bob's is all about service and quality. We had the best time at dinner. Great food, great service, and the other diners were clearly enjoying themselves as well. Conversations were struck up with the table next to us, and with a group at the bar, who turned out to also be in the hotel for the same breakfast meeting we were going to attend. One of the best dining experiences I have ahd, anywhere. I look forward to returning just for the opportunity to dine here, even if I am not a guest in the hotel. Now Bob's in a pricey steakhouse, with entrees in the $40.00 ++ range. Not every hotel guest would want to have this fine dining experience. The casual Texas Spice venue needs to get their act together for options for guests. We also think the casual restaurant should be open much later, certainly until at least 11:00 PM. A convention hotel needs to have viable options for the guests. Having both restaurants close at the same time seems poor management planning. There are two sports bars where bar food could be had, but the atmosphere is loud. Both of these venues were busy, which is a good sign for a new hotel. People are coming out here, both guests and locals. So what began as a challenge and provoking dining experience ended up being a pleasant and fun night. Now we return to the room, where apparently turn down had been done, as the curtains were closed, and two little bottles of water were left by the mini bar. THis is the oddest, and most superfluous turn down I have ever experienced. The beds were not touched, not turned down. The bathroom was not refreshed. Just two bottles of water and the curtains closed. Oh well... The next morning we are awaken with a gentle knock on the door where complimentary coffee for two along with the morning paper has been left for us. Very nice. Also, the wake up call and follow up were performed by a live person. A nice touch from the automated calls now done in so many hotels. We get ready to go down to the breakfast meeting we were in town for. Two people getting ready is just a bit challenging. Water pressure is very low, and the tub does not drain well. I would expect issues like this in an older hotel, but not new construction. I hope engineering can get this corrected. We proceed down to the third floor where the Trinity Ballroom is located and where The Dallas Convention And Visitors Bureau was holing its annual meeting and breakfast. This is an annual "dog and pony" show, which is entertaining and enthusiastic. Attending really makes one proud to and excited to be in Dallas, a part of the hospitality community! Much was made about the presence of the new convention center hotel and waht it means for the Dallas/Fort Worth area. This will be a great hotel to host city conventions, especially when utilizing the attached convention center. The hotel has beautiful meeting space. I would be excited to have a convention here, and in Dallas! Tours were offered after the meeting, so we saw other features of the hotel. The pool and wet area are attractive, but the pool and hot tub seem very small to accommodate 1000 hotel rooms and all the guests that might want to utilize these areas. The spa is beautiful as well, and how great to have a spa in the hotel to indulge oneself. Again the staff on duty just does not measure up to acceptable standards. knowing a group of people with the CVB are coming to tour the hotel, I would think and expect the hostess in the spa tp be welcoming and enthusiastic. This woman just stood behind the desk, said nothing, no welcome, no direction as to where to view the facilities. Eventually our group just made our way around and took in the space, with no explanation of just how extensive spa treatments are. I trust this is a full service spa, but cannot confirm that as no information was offered. Check out time is at 11:00 AM, where most upscale hotels offer at least 12 noon, or even 1:00 PM. We made our way to the front desk and reviewed the bill. The morning staff was much more on the ball than the afternoon staff. Each time I called down for the car from valet, it was ready and waiting, which is nice. All in all, it was a pleasant stay, and I look forward to having an opportunity to return. I hope the service issues I mentioned are improved for a return visit. Is anything a deal breaker for considering this hotel? NO. But it will be nice to see improvement. I am excited to have this hotel as an option in Dallas. I would be very happy to know a convention I was attending is booked at this property. I would feel good as a meeting planner booking this hotel. However, if I were a meeting planner, I would stipulate in the contract that staff would need to be beefed up and instructed how to display gracious Texas hospitality. With the exception of the concierge and Bob's Steak and Chop House, all ares of the hotel need improvement. If the hotel wants to keep the Omni name, it needs to meet Omni standards. for anyone reading this review, I hope it helps you, and I hope your visit will be pleasant. As for me, I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarrolltonTXTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for opening weekend. The decor and openness of the hotel is very dramatic. Beautiful Dallas-themed photographs and unique, but very comfortable, furnishings. We enjoyed the sports bar with more than 70 TV screens! The breakfast buffet in Texas Spice was excellent with lots of choices. We loved the rooftop hot tub at night, surrounded by the lights of downtown Dallas. We also warmed up next to the rooftop firepit. Room accommodations were excellent. The Omni is located in the heart of downtown Dallas, but we never needed to leave the hotel.
